text: Higher Education with a Higher Purpose

At Baptist College, you’ll acquire the skills and knowledge you need to learn, grow and succeed with a rewarding career in health care. We extend the learning environment beyond the classroom to include experiences found in real world health care settings throughout the Mid-South. We offer many unique programs of study. Regardless of what you choose, you’ll leave with the knowledge that you’ll be qualified to work in the most respected health care facilities in the world.
Your future in health care starts here.
Introducing the College’s new mascot, the Blue Healers

In the 107-year history of the College, the school has never had an officially-recognized mascot. The College recently changed its colors to shades of blue to identify more with the Baptist Memorial Health Care Corporation organization. Now with the new colors, comes a fun mascot.
Collaboration in practice can help students learn how to collaborate at bedside

In June 2019, a group of Baptist College of Health Sciences students and faculty from four different disciplines participated in a first-ever collaboration theater using real-life patient scenarios to solve a problem. The collaboration theater is part of the interpersonal education initiative PULSE (professionals united in life, service and education) lead by Kira Anderson, Angel Boling, and Benjamin Roberts, faculty at the College.
Baptist College Students Help the Homeless

Earlier this year, student volunteers from the Baptist College of Health Sciences participated in the county-wide Point-in-Time Count, helping the Community Alliance for the Homeless conduct needs assessment surveys with the homeless population in Memphis. The surveys will help identify gaps in health care and support services.

Get ready to embark on a journey of a lifetime.

At Baptist College, we'll help you prepare for a fulfilling and rewarding career in the health care field. We offer eleven unique programs of study. Regardless of what you choose, you'll leave with the knowledge that you'll be qualified to work in the most respected health care facilities in the world.

On behalf of the faculty, administration, and students at the Baptist College, we appreciate your interest. Use the links on this site to navigate through the admissions process.  Invest in a future in health care, and apply to Baptist College.

Priority admissions deadline; final scholarship deadline.
Final admissions deadline. Applicants who meet the admissions criteria by May 1st will be considered for admission based on available openings.
: Final admissions deadline. Applicants who meet the admissions criteria by October 15th will be considered for admission based on available openings.
: Admissions deadline. Applicants who meet the admissions criteria by March 1st will be considered for admission based on available openings.

Baptist College invites all prospective students and their families to visit the campus, labs, and learn more about Baptist College. If you would like to schedule a personal tour, please email
to set up a time to visit.

Click on the date below to register for an interest session, known as the freshman or transfer connection session. Sessions are for all prospective students to learn about admissions requirements, basic financial aid, scholarships, and academic programs.

Campus Visits are a great opportunity for you to meet with admissions staff and get your questions answered about admissions requirement, basic financial aid & scholarships and about our academic programs. Campus visits are done every Tuesday and Thursday at 10 am and 2 pm.

Preview Days are a great way to check out everything that's happening at Baptist College. Previously named open houses, preview day introduces you to the culture of Baptist and all the majors we offer. Please select a date to register.
